alert.note: Alert for Lamar (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 9:24AM CDT until July 04 at 1:45PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Eastern portions of Fannin County and western portions of Lamar County in northeast Texas * WHEN...Until 1145 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Honey Grove, Crockett Lake, Sumner, Coffee Mill Lake, Lake Gibbons, Pat Mayse Lake, Camp Maxey, Forest Hill, Toco, Tigertown, East Direct, Direct, Globe, Monkstown, Allens Point, Petty, Belk, Brookston, Garretts Bluff and Allens Chapel.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
